result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Kalbus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 30 days or penalty of 7 days jail for non payment.

Costs to be paid in 30 days or penalty of 4 days jail consecutive for non payment.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle J Kalbus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Character and treatment letters filed by Attorney Rowe.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kyle J Kalbus in court with attorney Jessica L. Rowe.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read into count #2. 
The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE: $316.00 (to be paid in 30 days or serve 11 days jail consecutive as penalty for nonpayment).
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid in 30 days).
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 7, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jessica L. Rowe in court.   Defendant Kyle J Kalbus did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rowe is still waiting for discovery.  The Court sets the matter for trial.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle J Kalbus
Current: 1422A North 53rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 03-28-2016)
Prior: 531 S 72nd St, West Allis, WI 53214
From Atty Rowe dated 3/28/16 re defendant's new address.

Attorney Jessica L. Rowe in court.   Defendant Kyle J Kalbus did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Rowe is waiting for additional discovery and requests additional time for receipt and review of the discovery.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Supplemental Demand for Discover and Inspection.

Attorney Jessica L. Rowe in court.   Defendant Kyle J Kalbus did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Attorney Rowe advises the Court she has received discovery and an offer and requests additional time to review the discovery with her client.  Attorney Rowe to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED MAY BE REFUNDED.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim listed in Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Kyle J Kalbus in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  State has offer to amend charge.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
